text:
In regards to profits from sports, I do find it a fascinating subject.  I would class myself on the lower end profits,  yes on the highest rate premium charge and make a a very nice income but nothing mind shattering.

Obviously there are people on here making a lot more income which is fantastic and I presume a lot of other people hoping to make a good second income.

As someone like I presume many here who have run previous businesses, I think although this way of making my income has been my favourite(and after many years of obsessional work least stressful as it so much more automated) actually statistcally not the best path, running a service or retail or other business has a much higher chance of success and can lead to to more profit, what are peoples thoughts.

text: Startup costs for Betfair trading are very cheap. It only cost me £2.5k to get started. I could have started with less on my bread and butter strategy. But I did not have it at the time.

text: A good foundation for running any business, is being passionate about it. And given events of the last year or so, it's smart not have all your eggs in one basket.

text: Crofty, totally right. Jonjon, I feel the issue is how many people lose rather than win, I spent only £300 starting up however I spent a long time doing data analysis, alas lots of people spend money and keep quiet, otherwise the others would never profit.

text:
I’m sure I’ve had one of the most successful betting _careers_ out of everyone on here but I’m certain that <@UGV299K6H> beats me for lifetime profits, I suspect <@U4H19D1D2> does as well (and I think it's fair to say that none of us are close to the likes of Benter, Bloom or Benham). I think that’s probably down to having always done my betting activities as part of a team rather than getting the whole pie to myself but on the flip side there are advantages to working as part of a team and it’s given me a breadth of industry knowledge that is probably close to unparalleled. Having had some of my profits stolen by the IRS also doesn’t help. I certainly don't feel well off in the London property market...

For example, I'm pretty sure if 11 years ago I went to work for a hedge fund instead of a new betting syndicate I would have more money today.

text: Ah ok fair enough. I suppose everything is relative to your point of view in life too. Current age aswell. For example, if I could make £1 million that would do me for the rest of my life. It is a lot of money, but I suspect that there are a few on here who have made way more than that.

text: I could not live in London. When I was in my early 20s nothing would have made me happier. Not anymore though and nothing to do with price of property.

text: Thats what I mean though - everyone's situation is different. I've no kids, live in a fairly affordable area for property. Don't have a drink drug or prostitute addiction so life is cheaper than it could be.

text: I think that the barrier to entry is also a relevant consideration. I'm sure that a hedge fund wouldn't go near me personally (although I did have lunch at one once) - but all I needed to start here was my laptop

text: Excellent point Peter. Getting an interview at a hedge fund is hard enough. And then you'll probably get asked a load of nonsense about algorithms in the interview, which will be hard if you aren't a recent computer science graduate .

text: I keep seeing mention of "TPD" - but I have no idea what it stands for :disappointed:

text: <http://www.totalperformancedata.com/>

attachments.title: Total Performance Data
attachments.text: Race timing data and positioning information for racehorses. Sectional timing, sectional times, UK racing, sports data.

text: Wow, I'm amazed I never came across that before.

elements.text: Wow, I'm amazed I never came across that before.

text: Most people on here that use it receive it through Betfair who have a certain number of licenses. It's also referred to as the "GPS feed"

text: Correct me if I'm wrong but looking at the TPD website, I get the feeling that they're not inviting subscriptions from punters - so you have to get access via a middlemen... How do you get access to it from Betfair? Is there a page on the Betfair website that tells you?
